intro: Senecio longipilus, commonly known as the long-hair senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
